oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Reproduction of a human figurine
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Alva Studios
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Reproduction of a Pre-Columbian figurine from the Diqui culture, Costa Rica. Figurine features a male, denoted by the prescence of genitalia, wearing a headdress, necklace, and holding a cylindrical object in each hand. Reproduction is made of gold-painted metal fixed to a wooden stand, whereas the original figurine would have been made of a copper-gold alloy and stood alone.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Antiquities, Prehistoric;Indians of Central America -- Antiquities;Indians of South America -- Antiquities
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: George and Louis Patten collection of Salem Hyde papers and cultural artifacts
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: George and Louise Patten collection of Salem Hyde cultural artifacts
